channel.title: Recomp on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Recomp on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Camper Van Mainframe
item.description: Today in Tedium: Portability is relative. When former Texas Instruments employees Rod Canion, Jim Harris and Bill Murto created a portable version of the IBM PC in 1982, it was a hulking device that weight 28 pounds and was roughly the size of a sewing machine. If you sold a desktop computer that weighed 28 pounds in 2018, youâ€™d be laughed off the block. But the device, called the Compaq Portable, was revolutionary for its time and thrust the company that made it into the mainstream.
